title: Mauricio Pochettino is no longer Man Utd's first choice Ole Gunnar Solskjaer replacement

Mauricio Pochettino is no longer Manchester United's first choice to replace Ole Gunnar Solskjaer should the Norwegian get the sack, according to reports.

The Tottenham boss has long been on the radar of Red Devils' executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward for some time, but United gave Solskjaer the gig permanently after he impressed while in temporary charge.

Solskjaer has struggled at the helm this season, with Manchester United just two points off of the relegation zone after eight games played.

The Norwegian is not in immediate danger of losing his job, given that Woodward recently gave him his backing, pointing out that he needs time to implement his style of play.

(Image: James Boardman/EPA-EFE/REX)

But Italian publication Gazzetta dello Sport claims that Manchester United have started to prepare for life after Solskjaer, should the axe be wield.

And Massimiliano Allegri has moved to the top of the wishlist, in place of Pochettino, who is currently struggling at Tottenham.

Allegri won Serie A five times in consecutive seasons at Juventus before leaving on a sabbatical at the end of the season.

(Image: UEFA via Getty Images)

He is reportedly learning how to speak English and would be keen on taking the Man United job, should he be offered it before the January transfer window.

The Italian is reportedly less inclined to take the reins of a club after this point as he wants a transfer window in which to sign new players.
description: Manchester United have been struggling this season and are currently two points off of the relegation zone
